title: Denver Broncos CB DeVante Bausby: 'I was paralyzed' for 30 minutes after collision
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Week 5 had revenge games and shocking upsets. Lorenzo Reyes delivers this weeks power rankings and biggest risers and fallers. USA TODAY

After he was taken off of the field on a backboard Sunday, Denver Broncos cornerback DeVante Bausby said he was “paralyzed” for half an hour and couldn’t move before gaining his mobility.

“I was awake the whole time,” Bausby told reporters Tuesday. “I was never unconscious. I just couldn’t move. But I was still talking and everything. The doctor said I’d be fine and I just kind of trusted him. After 30 minutes, I was able to wiggle my toes and after a couple of hours regain full mobility, so I was straight. I was fine.”

Bausby collided with Broncos teammate and linebacker Alexander Johnson during Sunday’s 20-13 victory against the Los Angeles Chargers shortly after he tackled running back Austin Ekeler early in the second quarter.

Play stopped and teammates quickly called on Denver’s medical staff to tend to Bausby. The medical trainers removed Bausby’s facemask and secured him to a backboard before taking him off the field and transporting him to the Los Angeles Trauma Center.

Bausby said he underwent further testing, scans, and X-rays.

“They said I was paralyzed for the first 30 minutes,” Bausby said.

Broncos coach Vic Fangio characterized the injury as “something with the spinal area” saying he didn’t know the technical term for it, but said it was had to do with “compression.” He added that he didn’t think it would need “drastic treatment” to heal but instead would simply require time.

“ ‘Baus’ is doing good,” Fangio said Monday. “No timetable on his return yet, but he’ll definitely miss some time. I don’t know if it’ll be the entire rest of the season or not, (with) these things the first few days and week will kind of tell the story.”

Bausby, 26, is in his third season in the league after stints with the Bears and the Eagles. He had emerged as a starter over Denver’s last two games and had totaled 13 tackles and three passes defended.

“Right now, we’re just going to take it real slow and gain my strength back,” Bausby said. “I don’t have a timetable, but hopefully pretty soon. My plan is to come back and play, though.”
description: After suffering a scary collision Sunday against the Chargers, Broncos CB DeVante Bausby said he was paralyzed for 30 minutes.
